attributes.action: Expand London’s Fare Zone 6 to Include More Stations
attributes.additional_details:
Many residents and visitors on the outskirts of London would benefit from an expanded Zone 6 as it would simplify fares and support local economies by encouraging greater use of public transport.

Nationalisation provides the opportunity for the next round of Zone 6 stations to be established and implemented as quickly as possible.
attributes.background: We ask the UK Government to work with Transport for London to add more stations to fare Zone 6 as train operators are nationalised.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Transport for London is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
